call for somebody/something.translation[: if a group of people call for something, they ask publicly for something to be done
Human Rights groups are calling for the release of political prisoners.
to need or deserve a particular type of behaviour or treatment
Dealing with children who are so damaged calls for immense tact and sensitivity.
That kind of abuse is really not called for (=it is unnecessary and unwelcome).
to meet someone at their home in order to take them somewhere
I’ll call for you at eight o'clock.
to say that a particular kind of weather is likely to happen
The forecast calls for more rain.
to ask publicly for something to happen
The company’s second largest shareholder is calling for the public flotation of the shares.
He called for Europe to work towards economic integration.
call for somebody to do something
